api_key.description: The API Key to use to connect to your account on Hopsworka.ai. Can be specified using the HOPSWORKSAI_API_KEY environment variable.

backup_name.description: The name to attach to this backup.

cluster_id.description: The id of the cluster for which you want to create a backup.

creation_date.description: The creation date of the backup. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

block.description: Use this resource to create a backup for your Hopsworks.ai clusters. The cluster has to be stopped to create a backup.

activation_state.description: The current activation state of the cluster.

attach_public_ip.description: Attach or do not attach a public ip to the cluster. This can be useful if you intend to create a cluster in a private network. Defaults to `true`.

backup_retention_period.description: The validity of cluster backups in days. If set to 0 cluster backups are disabled. Defaults to `0`.

creation_date.description: The creation date of the cluster. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

init_script.description: A bash script that will run on all nodes during their initialization (must start with #!/usr/bin/env bash)

issue_lets_encrypt_certificate.description: Enable or disable issuing let's encrypt certificates. This can be used to disable issuing certificates if port 80 can not be open. Defaults to `true`.

managed_users.description: Enable or disable Hopsworks.ai to manage your users. Defaults to `true`.

name.description: The name of the cluster, must be unique.

os.description: The operating system to use for the instances. Supported systems are ubuntu in all regions and centos in some specific regions Defaults to `ubuntu`.

run_init_script_first.description: Run the init script before any other node initialization. WARNING if your initscript interfere with the following node initialization the cluster may not start properly. Make sure that you know what you are doing.

ssh_key.description: The ssh key name that will be attached to this cluster.

start_date.description: The starting date of the cluster. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

state.description: The current state of the cluster.

tags.description: The list of custom tags to be attached to the cluster.

update_state.description: The action you can use to start or stop the cluster. Defaults to `none`.

upgrade_in_progress.description: Information about ongoing cluster upgrade if any.

url.description: The url generated to access the cluster.

version.description: The version of the cluster. For existing clusters, you can change this attribute to upgrade to a newer version of Hopsworks. If the upgrade process ended up in an error state, you can always rollback to the old version by resetting this attribute to the old version. Defaults to `2.4.0`.

disk_size.description: The disk size to use while auto scaling Defaults to `512`.

downscale_wait_time.description: The time to wait before removing unused resources. Defaults to `300`.

instance_type.description: The instance type to use while auto scaling.

max_workers.description: The maximum number of workers created by auto scaling. Defaults to `10`.

min_workers.description: The minimum number of workers created by auto scaling. Defaults to `0`.

standby_workers.description: The percentage of workers to be always available during auto scaling. If you set this value to 0 new workers will only be added when a job or a notebook requests the resources. This attribute will not be taken into account if you set the minimum number of workers to 0 and no resources are used in the cluster, instead, it will start to take effect as soon as you start using resources. Defaults to `0.5`.

fall_back_on_demand.description: Fall back to on demand instance if unable to allocate a spot instance Defaults to `true`.

max_price_percent.description: The maximum spot instance price in percentage of the on-demand price. Defaults to `100`.

block.description: The configuration to use spot instances
Setup auto scaling for gpu nodes.

This attribute will not be taken into account if you set the minimum number of workers to 0 and no resources are used in the cluster, instead, it will start to take effect as soon as you start using resources. bucket_name.description: The name of the S3 bucket that the cluster will use to store data in.

ecr_registry_account_id.description: The account id used for ECR. Defaults to the user's account id, inferred from the instance profille ARN.

eks_cluster_name.description: The name of the AWS EKS cluster.

instance_profile_arn.description: The ARN of the AWS instance profile that the cluster will be started with.

region.description: The AWS region where the cluster will be created.

block.description: The network configurations.
The configurations required to run the cluster on Amazon AWS.

acr_registry_name.description: The name of the ACR registry.

aks_cluster_name.description: The name of the AKS cluster.

location.description: The location where the cluster will be created.

resource_group.description: The resource group where the cluster will be created.

search_domain.description: The search domain to use for node address resolution. If not specified it will use the Azure default one (internal.cloudapp.net).  Use azure_attributes/network/search_domain instead.

storage_account.description: The azure storage account that the cluster will use to store data in.

storage_container_name.description: The name of the azure storage container that the cluster will use to store data in. If not specified, it will be automatically generated.

user_assigned_managed_identity.description: The azure user assigned managed identity that the cluster will be started with.

resource_group.description: The resource group where the network resources reside. If not specified, the azure_attributes/resource_group will be used.

search_domain.description: The search domain to use for node address resolution. If not specified it will use the Azure default one (internal.cloudapp.net).

block.description: The network configurations.
The configurations required to run the cluster on Microsoft Azure.

disk_size.description: The disk size of the head node in units of GB. Defaults to `512`.

instance_type.description: The instance type of the head node. Defaults to m5.2xlarge for AWS and Standard_D8_v3 for Azure.

block.description: The configurations of the head node of the cluster.

feature_store.description: Open the required ports to access the feature store from outside Hopsworks. Defaults to `false`.

kafka.description: Open the required ports to access kafka from outside Hopsworks. Defaults to `false`.

online_feature_store.description: Open the required ports to access the online feature store from outside Hopsworks. Defaults to `false`.

ssh.description: Open the ssh port (22) to allow ssh access to your cluster. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: Open the required ports to communicate with one of the Hopsworks services.

count.description: The number of API nodes. Defaults to `0`.

disk_size.description: The disk size of API nodes in units of GB Defaults to `30`.

instance_type.description: The instance type of the RonDB data node. Defaults to t3a.medium for AWS and Standard_D2s_v4 for Azure.

block.description: The configuration of API nodes.

grant_user_privileges.description: This allow API nodes to have user privileges access to RonDB. This is needed mainly for benchmarking and for that you need API nodes. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: The configurations required to benchmark RonDB.
The general configurations of RonDB.

replication_factor.description: The number of replicas created by RonDB for high availability. Defaults to `2`.

block.description: The configuration of RonDB data nodes.
The configuration of RonDB.

count.description: The number of data nodes. Notice that the number of RonDB data nodes have to be multiples of the replication_factor. Defaults to `2`.

disk_size.description: The disk size of data nodes in units of GB Defaults to `512`.

instance_type.description: The instance type of the RonDB data node. Defaults to t3a.xlarge for AWS and Standard_D4s_v4 for Azure.

block.description: The configuration of RonDB data nodes.

count.description: The number of management nodes. Defaults to `1`.

disk_size.description: The disk size of management nodes in units of GB Defaults to `30`.

instance_type.description: The instance type of the RonDB management node. Defaults to t3a.medium for AWS and Standard_D2s_v4 for Azure.

block.description: The configuration of RonDB management nodes.

count.description: The number of MySQL nodes. Defaults to `1`.

disk_size.description: The disk size of MySQL nodes in units of GB Defaults to `128`.

instance_type.description: The instance type of the RonDB data node. Defaults to t3a.medium for AWS and Standard_D2s_v4 for Azure.

block.description: The configuration of MySQL nodes.
Setup a cluster with managed RonDB.

count.description: The number of worker nodes. Defaults to `1`.

disk_size.description: The disk size of worker nodes in units of GB Defaults to `512`.

instance_type.description: The instance type of the worker nodes.

fall_back_on_demand.description: Fall back to on demand instance if unable to allocate a spot instance Defaults to `true`.

max_price_percent.description: The maximum spot instance price in percentage of the on-demand price. Defaults to `100`.

block.description: The configuration to use spot instances
The configurations of worker nodes. You can add as many as you want of this block to create workers with different configurations.
Use this resource to create, read, update, and delete clusters on Hopsworks.ai.

activation_state.description: The current activation state of the cluster.

attach_public_ip.description: Attach or do not attach a public ip to the cluster. This can be useful if you intend to create a cluster in a private network.

backup_retention_period.description: The validity of cluster backups in days. If set to 0 cluster backups are disabled.

creation_date.description: The creation date of the cluster. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

head.description: The configurations of the head node of the cluster.

init_script.description: A bash script that will run on all nodes during their initialization (must start with #!/usr/bin/env bash)

issue_lets_encrypt_certificate.description: Enable or disable issuing let's encrypt certificates. This can be used to disable issuing certificates if port 80 can not be open.

managed_users.description: Enable or disable Hopsworks.ai to manage your users.

name.description: The name of the cluster, must be unique.

os.description: The operating system to use for the instances. Supported systems are ubuntu in all regions and centos in some specific regions

rondb.description: Setup a cluster with managed RonDB.

run_init_script_first.description: Run the init script before any other node initialization. WARNING if your initscript interfere with the following node initialization the cluster may not start properly. Make sure that you know what you are doing.

ssh_key.description: The ssh key name that will be attached to this cluster.

start_date.description: The starting date of the cluster. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

state.description: The current state of the cluster.

tags.description: The list of custom tags to be attached to the cluster.

update_state.description: The action you can use to start or stop the cluster. Defaults to `none`.

upgrade_in_progress.description: Information about ongoing cluster upgrade if any.

url.description: The url generated to access the cluster.

version.description: The version of the cluster. For existing clusters, you can change this attribute to upgrade to a newer version of Hopsworks. If the upgrade process ended up in an error state, you can always rollback to the old version by resetting this attribute to the old version.

disk_size.description: The disk size to use while auto scaling Defaults to `512`.

downscale_wait_time.description: The time to wait before removing unused resources. Defaults to `300`.

instance_type.description: The instance type to use while auto scaling.

max_workers.description: The maximum number of workers created by auto scaling. Defaults to `10`.

min_workers.description: The minimum number of workers created by auto scaling. Defaults to `0`.

standby_workers.description: The percentage of workers to be always available during auto scaling. If you set this value to 0 new workers will only be added when a job or a notebook requests the resources. This attribute will not be taken into account if you set the minimum number of workers to 0 and no resources are used in the cluster, instead, it will start to take effect as soon as you start using resources. Defaults to `0.5`.

fall_back_on_demand.description: Fall back to on demand instance if unable to allocate a spot instance Defaults to `true`.

max_price_percent.description: The maximum spot instance price in percentage of the on-demand price. Defaults to `100`.

feature_store.description: Open the required ports to access the feature store from outside Hopsworks. Defaults to `false`.

kafka.description: Open the required ports to access kafka from outside Hopsworks. Defaults to `false`.

online_feature_store.description: Open the required ports to access the online feature store from outside Hopsworks. Defaults to `false`.

count.description: The number of worker nodes. Defaults to `1`.

disk_size.description: The disk size of worker nodes in units of GB Defaults to `512`.

Use this resource to create a cluster from an existing backup.

bucket_name.description: Limit permissions to this S3 bucket.

enable_backup.description: Add permissions required to allow creating backups of your clusters. Defaults to `true`.

enable_cloud_watch.description: Add permissions required to allow collecting your cluster logs using cloud watch. Defaults to `true`.

enable_eks_and_ecr.description: Add permissions required to enable access to Amazon EKS and ECR from within your Hopsworks cluster. Defaults to `true`.

enable_storage.description: Add permissions required to allow Hopsworks clusters to read and write from and to your aws S3 buckets. Defaults to `true`.

enable_upgrade.description: Add permissions required to enable upgrade to newer versions of Hopsworks. Defaults to `true`.

json.description: The instance profile policy in JSON format.

block.description: Use this data source to get the aws instance profile policy needed by Hopsworks.ai

enable_aks_and_acr.description: Add permissions required to enable access to Azure AKS and ACR from within your Hopsworks cluster. Defaults to `false`.

enable_backup.description: Add permissions required to allow creating backups of your clusters. Defaults to `true`.

enable_storage.description: Add permissions required to allow Hopsworks clusters to read and write from and to your azure storage accounts. Defaults to `true`.

enable_upgrade.description: Add permissions required to enable upgrade to newer versions of Hopsworks. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: Use this data source to get the azure user assigned identity permissions needed by Hopsworks.ai

backup_name.description: The name to attach to this backup.

cluster_id.description: The id of the cluster for which you want to create a backup.

creation_date.description: The creation date of the backup. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

block.description: Use this data source to retrieve backup information using its id.

backups.description: The list of backups sorted based on creation date with latest created backup first.

cluster_id.description: The id of the cluster to retrieve its backups. If not set, all the backups are retrieved.

block.description: Use this data source to retrieve all your backups.

activation_state.description: The current activation state of the cluster.

attach_public_ip.description: Attach or do not attach a public ip to the cluster. This can be useful if you intend to create a cluster in a private network.

aws_attributes.description: The configurations required to run the cluster on Amazon AWS.

azure_attributes.description: The configurations required to run the cluster on Microsoft Azure.

backup_retention_period.description: The validity of cluster backups in days. If set to 0 cluster backups are disabled.

creation_date.description: The creation date of the cluster. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

head.description: The configurations of the head node of the cluster.

init_script.description: A bash script that will run on all nodes during their initialization (must start with #!/usr/bin/env bash)

issue_lets_encrypt_certificate.description: Enable or disable issuing let's encrypt certificates. This can be used to disable issuing certificates if port 80 can not be open.

managed_users.description: Enable or disable Hopsworks.ai to manage your users.

name.description: The name of the cluster, must be unique.

open_ports.description: Open the required ports to communicate with one of the Hopsworks services.

os.description: The operating system to use for the instances. Supported systems are ubuntu in all regions and centos in some specific regions

rondb.description: Setup a cluster with managed RonDB.

run_init_script_first.description: Run the init script before any other node initialization. WARNING if your initscript interfere with the following node initialization the cluster may not start properly. Make sure that you know what you are doing.

ssh_key.description: The ssh key name that will be attached to this cluster.

start_date.description: The starting date of the cluster. The date is represented in RFC3339 format.

state.description: The current state of the cluster.

tags.description: The list of custom tags to be attached to the cluster.

update_state.description: The action you can use to start or stop the cluster.

upgrade_in_progress.description: Information about ongoing cluster upgrade if any.

url.description: The url generated to access the cluster.

version.description: The version of the cluster. For existing clusters, you can change this attribute to upgrade to a newer version of Hopsworks. If the upgrade process ended up in an error state, you can always rollback to the old version by resetting this attribute to the old version.

workers.description: The configurations of worker nodes. You can add as many as you want of this block to create workers with different configurations.

block.description: Use this data source to get information about a cluster on Hopsworks.ai.

clusters.description: The list of clusters in the user's account.

block.description: Filter requested clusters based on cloud provider.
Use this data source to get information about all your clusters in Hopsworks.ai

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider where you plan to create your cluster.

min_cpus.description: Filter based on the minimum number of CPU cores. Defaults to `0`.

min_gpus.description: Filter based on the minimum number of GPUs. Defaults to `0`.

min_memory_gb.description: Filter based on the minimum memory in gigabytes. Defaults to `0`.

node_type.description: The node type that you want to get its smallest instance type. It has to be one of these types (head, worker, rondb_management, rondb_data, rondb_mysql, rondb_api).

block.description: Use this data source to get the smallest instance type for head, worker, and RonDB nodes.

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider where you plan to create your cluster.

node_type.description: The node type that you want to get its supported instance types.

supported_types.description: The list of supported instance types.

block.description: Use this data source to get all the supported instance types for head, worker, and RonDB nodes.

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider where you plan to create your cluster.

default.description: The version is the default version.

experimental.description: The version is an experimental version.

os.description: Filter based on the supported os.

release_notes_url.description: The release notes url for this version.

supported_regions.description: The list of supported operating systems per regions.

upgradeable_from_version.description: The version which is upgradeable to this version.

block.description: Use this data source to get the latest supported Hopsworks version.
